glsa.title: IPsec-Tools: authentication bug in racoon
glsa.synopsis: racoon provided as part of IPsec-Tools fails do proper authentication.

background.p: IPsec-Tools is a port of KAME's implementation of the IPsec utilities. It contains a collection of network monitoring tools, including racoon, ping, and ping6.

description.p: The KAME IKE daemon racoon is used to authenticate peers during Phase 1 when using either preshared keys, GSS-API, or RSA signatures. When using RSA signatures racoon validates the X.509 certificate but not the RSA signature.

impact.p: By sending a valid and trusted X.509 certificate and any private key an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform man-in-the-middle attacks and initiate unauthorized connections.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time. All users are encouraged to upgrade to the latest available version.
